page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF AREA
page.content: The area is dominated by the valley of the{River Tame.}The river(a tributary of the River Mersey)flows between the towns of Mossley in the north and the outskirts of Stalybridge in the south.The whole of the block is in the Tameside Metropolitan Borough,part of the County of Greater Manchester.The other settlements in the block are the villages of Carrbrook,Millbrook and Heyrod.The main{routes}follow the valley bottom north/south and comprise the Huddersfield Narrow Canal,the main transpennine rail link between Manchester and Yorkshire and the A635 road to Holmfirth.The{hills}to the east of the block rise to over 1,000ft. and are managed as grouse moors.They are part of the Pennine range.
